Anthony and Amy are absolutely wonderful hosts and communicated about everything on our trip. They are accessible, warm and friendly. Delightful.
The apartment is beyond stunning. Absolutely gorgeous. It is a 3rd floor loft above the Dark Horse Tavern on Main Street. It is VERY VERY COOL. Everything on Main Street is within walking distance and SUNY Cortland is only maybe a mile walk away.
The apartment is huge. The bathroom is gigantic and deluxe. Beautiful dark wood floors, Keurig with coffee, and even laundry just make this place perfect. Just a beautiful place. Truly.
A parking spot is provided directly behind the bar. Anthony will meet you with the key.
It should be noted that the apartment requires climbing narrow stairs to the 3rd floor.
Bar noise at 1am should also be considered. Anthony does disclose it when booking. There were no secrets as to what to expect. I, however, did not remember all the fun noises college kids make, beer bottles, car alarms and screaming. Lol.

review_text: The house is clean, homey, spacious and lovely. There were so many amenities that we made good use of (including an old style pacman game machine on the bottom floor, board games and giant, lovely TVs). The house was beautiful wood and tile, there were so many welcoming, homey touches to the environment such as posters and wall decorations. The electronics and appliances were all in perfect working order, and the hostess was amazing at getting back to me through text whenever I had a question. There was plenty of space for 7 people to lounge and relax after a day of hiking and walking. I adored the view from the windows (green as far as the eye can see!) and the covers, blankets, and mattresses were all in perfect condition. The bottom beds in the 2 bunk beds were full beds and comfortably fit 2 people so we never even had to use the top bunks. The house has amazing central AC/heating systems. The kitchen was easily my favorite, with a beautiful spacious island and a stove top (if you press the button on the top right, you get a small vent that pops up!) and wood accented fridge/freezer with plenty of room, SO much cabinet space and a well kept sink. The washer/dryer's were also in great working condition, and much appreciated as there was a sudden downpour on one of the bikes we went on. I have never been so impressed by the condition of an airbnb stay before. You won't regret booking here!

review_text: Hands down one of our favorite rentals. They thought of everything, I don’t have enough great things to say! My 11 year old daughter and her best friend thought it was the “best places they have ever been”. We were honestly walking distance to the mountain, easy access to the lodge’s amenities, and perfectly fine for sitting in by the fireplace. I never had Greek peek on my radar before, but I am telling you I would come back here just to be able to stay here again! If you are on the fence I’m telling you if you have a small group or couples trip, this is the place
